poem:
Title: "Unfastened by Identity"

In Mona's curious exhibit space,
Masters, Mistresses of disguise,
Fly through time and old-fashioned place,
Beyond gendered, painted lies.
In the Ladies Lounge now dwell,
Souls revealed under moonlit men,
Allowed, no longer in shell,
In Hobart's old and new den.
Tasmanian law has unlocked the door,
For human art to be free,
To be, to breathe, and to explore,
The myriad ways of 'we'.
